title: Adobe Acrobat Reader DC XFA Form Use-After-Free Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Adobe Acrobat Reader DC. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.
The specific flaw exists within the processing of form instances within XFA templates. The issue results from the lack of validating the existence of an object prior to performing operations on the object. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current process.
addtionnal_details: Adobe has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/acrobat/apsb19-49.html
timeline:
2019-09-19 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2019-10-15 - Coordinated public release of advisory
